ABOUT ME
I'm Varun.
I am a full-time traveller now (yes, I quit my job to follow my dreams). I love solo travelling & meeting people. After travelling extensively in Incredible India for years, I stepped out of my country and realised, how beautiful the world is! I started making travel web series in Hindi full of travel tips and tricks, especially for budget travel and sustainable tourism. My dream is to inspire people to explore this beautiful world and learn the best things to make our world a better place to live in. I was awarded the prestigious 'National Tourism Award' by the Government of India for my contributions in the field of promotion of Tourism. Thanks to my viewers, I now get invitations from across the globe to visit their places and show them to the world.

title: Indian hitchhiker with Russian Roadtrippers : Beautiful Russia (Gorno-Altaysk)
description:
Today was the 8th day of ‘hitchhiking in Russia’ trip. After a short visit to Alex and Marina’s apartment in Byisk, I started to hitchhike for Gorno-Altaysk, the capital town of Altai Republic. The total distance between Gorno Altaysk and Byisk is 108 kilometres. Thanks to Alex and Marina who dropped me on the outskirts of the Byisk town. I always choose to start hitchhiking from a point outside of the city. There are more chances of getting a lift for a long distance if you stand outside of a city or town.

If you like my videos, PLEASE SHARE them and let others get inspired to explore this beautiful world. SUBSCRIBE to the channel - http://bit.ly/subscribeMT

title: Frankfurt to Toronto: Air Canada | See whom I met!
description:
I flew Air Canada from Frankfurt to Toronto. Flight duration from Frankfurt to Toronto is 8 hours. I have shared information on how is the inflight entertainment on the Frankfurt-Toronto flight, Vegetarian Food on the Air Canada flight, etc. After landing at Toronto Pearson Airport (YYZ), I have shown how is the arrival terminal, how was my experience with Immigration in Canada; the fastest and cheapest options to travel from Toronto Pearson airport to Toronto Downtown. You will get to know about the airport train UP express from the airport to Union Station, bus 900 from Pearson airport, etc. I took a bus from Toronto airport to Niagara.

title: 'Indian Passport! YOU CAN'T LEAVE THIS COUNTRY' - Worst Immigration experience (ENG SUB) | EP #40
description:
This was my worst ever immigration experience. Despite having all the valid documents and permissions, this Serbian immigration officer said, "You can't board the flight. You can't leave the country as you have overstayed your visa in Serbia". Watch this video to know the proper Serbian immigration rules for Indians. However, this situation can happen to anyone, anywhere in the world, so watch it and get prepared. This video was shot on 21st November 2020. 

Indians get visa-free entry to Serbia for up to 30 days. 
Foreign nationals (including Indians) having a valid visa or resident permit issued by Schengen, UK or US may, without prior visa application, enter, transit or stay in the Republic of Serbia for up to 90 days during a six-month period, but not exceeding the expiring date of the said visas or residence permits. OFFICIAL LINK - http://www.mfa.gov.rs/en/consular-affairs/entry-serbia/visa-regime

This is a part of travel web series based on my trip to Serbia. I travelled from Delhi to Belgrade via Dubai availing the visa-free entry for Indians in Serbia for 30 days. Watch all the videos in sequence here http://bit.ly/MTserbia2020. #SerbiaImmigration #IndianinSerbia #SerbiaTravel 

If you like my videos, PLEASE SHARE them and let others get inspired to explore this beautiful world. SUBSCRIBE to the channel - http://bit.ly/subscribeMT

title: Why did he hit me! A sad day in Mauritius
description:
http://bit.ly/subscribeMT
This video is about my visit to the Crocodile Park in Mauritius, also called La Vanille Crocodile Park. The experience at the park was not very positive. Though I have shared important information like the entrance fee for Vanille Crocodile Park, etc. You will also see a glimpse of my hotel Sofitel and Hotel Telfair. These are some of the luxury hotels in Mauritius and usually preferred for Honeymoon and destination weddings. Yes, Mauritius is one of the ideal places for destination weddings for Indians. Thereafter I visited Frederica Nature Reserve (Mauritius), also called Heritage Nature Reserve. Check to know about the prices of different activities like trekking or a trip to the Frederica Nature Reserve in modified 4-wheeled Land Cruiser. Also, watch me doing Canoeing and playing Golf at Heritage Golf club. Though something bad happened there. Watch this video to see what was that!

title: EGYPT: Vegetarian food | Mobile Sim | Indian Spy !!
description:
http://bit.ly/subscribeMT
In this video, you will see me 'hunting' for the best mobile network in Egypt. Based on the feedback from many people I chose to buy Vodafone. The sim cost me 150 LE. Talking about the availability of vegetarian food in Egypt, it is not that difficult as it was for me in most of the South-East Asian countries. I have shared my food expenses in this video. title: My First day in Kazakhstan: Sim | Local Currency | Public transport | Hotel
description:
http://bit.ly/subscribeMT
This video series is about my trip to Kazakhstan, Turkey and Georgia. This episode is based on the first day in Almaty, the largest city of Kazakhstan. I stayed in hotel Ramada, #Almaty for just 1 US Dollar. Check Air Astana Stopover Holiday for more information on how to stay in star hotels in Almaty and Astana in just 1 US Dollar!

I purchased Tele 2 mobile sim in Almaty, Kazakhstan. Watch this video to know the rate of the sim card and how much I paid for the internet data. Also, you will see me withdrawing the local currency #Tenge using my Indian banks debit card. I have shared an information about a trick by which you won't be charged bank commission for money withdrawal. I visited a Local supermarket to buy vegetarian food in Almaty. Check the rate of the things I bought from there. 

I travelled on local buses in Almaty. The bus fare in August 2018 (when I was there) was 150 Tenge. Watch the video for more information on how to travel cheaper than this by using a particular travel card.

title: ISTANBUL: Safe for Female Travel? Affordable for Vegetarians!
description:
http://bit.ly/subscribeMT & http://www.touristhelpline.com/istanbul-safe-for-female-travel-how-cheap-for-vegetarians/
This video is based on the initial days of my trip to Turkey. I stayed in Dongyang Hotel near Sultan Ahmet area in Istanbul for a few days. You will get an idea about the cost of a hotel or hostel in Istanbul in this video. I visited a supermarket called Sok in the Sirkeci area of Istanbul. I have shared the cost of things I bought from there. If you are also a vegetarian budget traveller like me, this part of the video would be helpful for you.  I visited a souvenir shop near Sultan Ahmet called Ottoman Art in Sirkeci, bought some souvenirs from there. Thereafter I met some volunteers who help tourist visiting Istanbul. Watch the interesting conversation with the school girls about India, Bollywood, Amir Khan, Shahrukh Khan, Indian soap operas like Utaran. They revealed some interesting things about their mother and grandmothers in this context ;) I also visited a local mobile sim shop near Sultan Ahmet to find the cheapest mobile networks available in Turkey. Then you'll watch interesting sessions with Turkish & Afghan fruit sellers and at the end, you will see me travelling in Istanbul tram to Kabatas for visiting Taksim Square. There also I met an interesting tour guide who helped me reach Taksim Square and understand a few basics about Turkey. 
#ISTANBUL #TURKEY #IstanbulTravelGuide

title: Indian Embassy & Booking.com EXPOSED | 5000 Rs BRIBE - Kyrgyzstan
description:
Travelling abroad! Don’t get stuck due to weird rules despite having a valid visa. I got stuck in Kyrgyzstan and had a tough time. Face corrupt officials, had arguments with locals and got denied any help by my home country’s embassy.  

0:00 - Preview
00:44 - RUSSIA - Registration of Foreigners after arrival
1:22 - Kyrgyzstan - Registration of Foreigners after arrival
2:05 - Visa Overstay in Kyrgyzstan
4:27 - Why foreigner’s registration is required?
5:55 - India should make Tourist friendly laws
6:54 - Foreigners Registration process in Kyrgyzstan
7:54 - Duration for Indians, Registration in Kyrgyzstan
8:39 - I stayed in illegal hostel
9:15 - Hot talks with locals
11:36 - FRAUD on Booking.com - Scam
14:03 - Kyrgyz officer asked for BRIBE
15:48 - Why Indian Embassy didn’t help!
20:09 - Finally got the registration done
22:17 - Travel ‘tips’ by Indian Embassy, you Should NOT follow

This video is a part of my Kyrgyzstan travel series - http://bit.ly/MTkyrgyzstan2019. I spent 3 months in Kyrgyzstan in late 2019. Besides Bishkek, Karakol, Issyk Kul (lake) which are the most popular destinations in Kyrgyzstan, I visited some offbeat places like Jyrgalan valley, Song Kul (lake). Did horse riding trips, stayed in Yurt camps, hitchhiked and stayed with locals. I volunteered in village farms, hostels and NGOs to get the holistic experience of my trip and central Asian culture. All this you will find In this series. #Kyrgyzstan #TouristScam #TravelVlog

title: COUCHSURFING FOR GIRLS!! My experience with a Female Couchsurfer in Turkey
description:
http://bit.ly/subscribeMT

Is Couchsurfing safe for a solo traveller? I have been asked this question a number of times, especially when it comes to Couchsurfing for female travel. This video is based on my experience with a Female Couchsurfer in Turkey. I visited her place in Tekirdag, Thrace region in September 2018. 

My Couchsurfing host took me to Uçmakdere, a small village in the hills near Tekirdag. Distance from Tekirdag to Ucmakdere is around 35 kilometres and become quite scenic after the hills start. We relished delicious Gozleme and the Turkish Ayran. Watch this video to know about these local Turkish delicacies.

title: Why Russians loved this Indian tourist! (Chusky Tract: Altai Mountains)
description:
http://bit.ly/susbscribeMT Previous video - https://youtu.be/2f-SK-S2nks
Watch this video to know why almost every Russian loved this Indian tourist! An Indian backpacker took this video during hitchhiking in Russia in 2017. The location in the video is Chusky Tract in the beautiful Altai Mountains. To be specific about the location the video was shot between Barangol & Onguday in the Altay region of Russia. This area is in the Siberia, which is one of the coldest parts on earth. So you will see a lot of snow in a particular stretch (Seminsky Pass) in this video.

title: TOURIST TRAPS IN ISTANBUL: Caught on Camera | Taksim Square, Sultan Ahmet...
description:
http://bit.ly/subscribeMT & http://www.touristhelpline.com/tourist-scams-in-istanbul-caught-on-camera/
In this video, you will see a tourist scam in Istanbul. It is based on my visit to famous tourist places in Istanbul like Taksim Square, Istiklal street and Sultan Ahmet. I visited there in September 2018. During my visit to the Istiklal street, I was approached by two people who pretended to be a tourist. Watch this video to know how did they approached me and tried to get friendly. They asked me to join for bear, which I refused. I was already warned about this by the staff at the hostel where I stayed. The same thing happened with me on the next day in Sultan Ahmet, another popular tourist place in Istanbul. Usually, these people target Solo tourists. After watching this video, I am sure you will come to know about Dos and Donts while travelling in Istanbul and how to handle such situations. 
Check this link to know about other types of 'Tourist Scams' in Istanbul. http://www.touristhelpline.com/tourist-scams-in-istanbul-caught-on-camera/ #Scam #Turkey #Istanbul

title: How to reach ISTANBUL Main Bus Terminal | Istanbul To Tekirdag bus
description:
http://bit.ly/subscribeMT
This video is about one of the best bus journeys I have ever had! Thanks to this little friend...  I travelled on a bus from Istanbul to Tekirdag. Took Istanbul Seyahat bus to Tekirdag from the main bus terminal called Esenler Otogar or Büyük Otogar. It is located in Bayrampasa district so people also call it Bayrampaşa Bus Terminal. A bus terminal is called Otogar in Turkish. If I am not wrong Esenler Otogar is the bus terminal for many international buses for Bulgaria, Romania, Greece, Balkan countries and other Middle-East countries. Watch this video to know how was my experience of buying a ticket at Esenler Bus Terminal. 

The bus journey from Istanbul to Tekirgag was a bliss. We took state road D100 which connects Bulgaria to Iran. The road was good. Landscapes were great. But the best part of this journey was my travel companion. A little boy who was accompanying his father, also the bus pilot. You'll see him as well in the video. Bus fare from Istanbul to Tekirdag is 32 Lira in Istanbul Seyahat bus.

title: How to plan a Europe trip from India? (First hand info on Flight, Hotels, Visa, etc.)
description:
# Cheap flights from India to Europe - https://goo.gl/GqCbGt
# Cheap hotels in Europe - https://goo.gl/rNBD2r
# 15 days in Europe in just 10,000 Rupees - https://goo.gl/M2Ux1k
# Blog - http://www.touristhelpline.com/planning-europe-trip-from-india/

I did my first ever trip to Europe in late 2016. I learnt a lot of things during this trip which eventually helped me to shape my budget travelling in more organised way. Interestingly, I managed all the expenditures during my 15 days long trip in just Rs. 10,000 (INR). You must read my blog to know how I made this possible. Here is the link http://www.touristhelpline.com/i-travelled-europe-in-10000/

Based on the experience of that trip, I am going to share some information which may be very helpful for everyone who is planning to do a Europe trip, especially for the first timers. 

The inputs are broadly based on these topics - 
 
1. Which are the best countries in Europe for a budget traveller? (After watching this video and other ones coming up in this series, I am sure you will know that travelling in Europe is no more a costly affair)

2. Which are the cheapest flights from India to Europe? (I have shared some tricks which will help you to get cheap flight tickets to Europe)

3. What are the visa formalities to visit European countries? (Though you are required to do a bit of paperwork to get the visa but all the hard work pay at the end. After getting THIS visa you can visit almost 26 countries)

My blog: touristhelpline.com
Contact me - facebook.com/page.mountaintrekker/

You'll like the playlist based on my recent hitchhiking trip in Thailand - https://goo.gl/dOUJck

title: Why I Left India & Moved to Germany?

title: KYRGYZSTAN: My first day in country's capital - Bishkek
description:
http://bit.ly/subscribeMT
How safe is Kyrgyzstan! If this question bothers you, then you must watch this video. This is based on my first day in Bishkek, the capital city of Kyrgyzstan. I have shared information about Manas International airport, Bishkek. You will come to know about facilities like ATM, Currency Exchange, Free Wifi at Bishkek airport. Also, I have shared inputs on how to reach the Bishkek city centre from the airport. I took a minibus which is the cheapest way to travel from Manas International airport to Bishkek. I stayed in a hostel in Bishkek and then visited Osh bazar to buy sim. So if you are also looking for a tourist sim in Kyrgyzstan, then you must watch this video. Also features the public transportation system in Bishkek. Marshrutka Fare in Bishkek. #BishkekAirport #TouristSim #Kyrgyzstan

title: OLD LADY, ALONE on Qatar Airways (USA to India)
description:
I met this old lady at San Fransisco Airport while flying back from the USA to India on Qatar Airways. This was an eye-opener for me. How the elderly people who have to travel alone have an experience! I also have a suggestion in this video. 
This video was shot in Early 2021. Amidst the COVID pandemic, I spent almost 3 months in the USA & explored Louisiana, Texas, Arizona & California states in a different manner.  Watch the entire series at http://bit.ly/MTusa2021. #SFO #USATravelVlog #MountainTrekker . This was my second trip to the USA. Watch my first American trip at http://bit.ly/MTusa2018

title: and FINALLY THIS HAPPENED in Canada
description:
http://bit.ly/subscribeMT
This video is based on the experiences I had while visiting the major tourist attractions in Quebec City. In earlier video you saw me visiting Montmorency falls. In this video you can see me visiting the Old Quebec city, Chateau Frontenac, Taking a ferry from Quebec city to Levis, watching a short movie based on the history of Quebec and Canada. I stayed in Hotel Marriot which is in the Old Quebec city and most of the worth visiting places in Quebec city are located around it. And finally a few words for my travel companion Barkha Singh. title: Why this Indian family settled in Kyrgyzstan!
description:
Welcome to the world of Richa, Ankit and Reyan. An Indian family settled in Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan. They opened their home for a video tour and shared their experience and tips for settling abroad.  

0:00 - Video Highlights
0:55 - House Tour, Bishkek 
4:30 - Kitchen Tour, No LPG cylinder
5:57 - Jobless despite highly educated?
7:38 - HIS job in Kyrgyzstan
8:17 - His startup journey
10:43 - Central Room heating system without Electricity
12:20 - Indian food stores in Kyrgyzstan
14:27 - Bed Room Tour, House Rent in Bishkek
16:47 - Washroom Tour
18:30 - HER job in Kyrgyzstan
19:30 - how to become a teacher abroad
20:40 - These schools have a job for you
23:05 - before & after HER marriage
24:35 - USA vs Kyrgyzstan - Job opportunities
25:59 - Tips- How to find opportunities abroad?
27:26 - Kids in abroad forget Indian culture?
29:07 - Best country to settle down with family
29:55 - No need for IELTS
31:45 - Last video of Kyrgyzstan series?  

This video is a part of my Kyrgyzstan travel series - http://bit.ly/MTkyrgyzstan2019. I spent 3 months in Kyrgyzstan in late 2019. Besides Bishkek, Karakol, Issyk Kul (lake) which are the most popular destinations in Kyrgyzstan, I visited some offbeat places like Jyrgalan valley, Song Kul (lake). Did horse riding trips, stayed in Yurt camps, hitchhiked and stayed with locals. I volunteered in village farms, hostels and NGOs to get the holistic experience of my trip and central Asian culture. All this you will find In this series. #Kyrgyzstan #SettleAbroad #opportunities

title: Air Asia : India to Bangkok (4000 Rs) : Everything recorded and explained :First timers MUST WATCH
description:
Previous video = https://youtu.be/MgIeCPDUb7c
Next Video = https://youtu.be/-Yjxs0LZ0Og
playlist - https://goo.gl/dOUJck (Hitchhiking in Thailand)


This was my first flight with Air Asia. 
Air Asia is one of the major low budget airlines in Asia. Sometimes they offer dirt cheap fares, but I had few apprehensions before flying with them for the first time. I heard that they are very strict at charging for every kilo over the stipulated weight limit. I also came to know that the seats are not comfortable and offer very less leg space. 

Watch this video to know how was my first experience with Air Asia. I took their flight from Kolkata to Bangkok (CCU to DMK)  

Watch other videos of my Thailand trip in this playlist https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLzx8veYOxQ8_Tn4oIjv2gU6JiatrjehC3

title: Worst Immigration officer - I met in Oman
description:
Thanks to the ever-changing immigration rules, I experienced my worst immigration experience ever while crossing the Oman-UAE border. I was rejected twice. Once at the UAE checkpost and then at the Oman checkpost.  Watch this video to know how did I manage to clear the Immigration after almost 14 hours. This video was shot in December 2021.

title: WE BECAME KIDS IN KOREA (Everland, Seoul) | TAX-FREE SHOPPING FOR TOURISTS
description:
This video is based on my visit to Everland Resort in Seoul. It is the biggest theme park in Korea.  During the visit, I happened to pass from the rush hour traffic of Seoul city. I observed a few things which can be helpful to reduce traffic congestion in urban areas. I hope this video reaches to the concern authorities so that they can implement the best practices to solve the traffic jam problem in cities like Delhi, Mumbai, Bangalore, etc. Also includes Tax-free shopping for tourists in Seoul and Best app for maps in Korea. #Seoul #Everland #TaxFreeShopping

title: HOW I GOT RUSSIAN CURRENCY (Ruble) & LOCAL SIM IN RUSSIA ?
description:
How to get Russia visa - http://www.touristhelpline.com/how-i-got-russian-tourist-visa/

SUBSCRIBE - https://goo.gl/dEtSMJ (‘MountainTrekker’)
Previous video - https://youtu.be/8yD8ENUDe1A
Next video - https://youtu.be/ZD12D7VRN0o

This is the first day of my Russian trip. I am in Omsk. In this video, you can see how to get a tourist sim in Russia. Also, you will come to know how to get Russian Ruble. Instead of using a money exchanger I used an ATM which had its services available in English. Surprisingly, I got an excellent exchange rate by using the ATM. I have shared the ATM's receipt and the SMS I got from my Indian bank in the video. I don't know this happened because of the Indian bank or it was a special feature of the Russian bank which owns the ATM. I can recommend this bank's ATM to every traveller as it gives a better exchange rate.  

In this video, there is a query about a free offer provided by the mobile operator. Watch it and reply in the comments section.

title: Finding Indian Soldier's Graves after 103 years | Gallipoli, Turkey (Part 1)
description:
http://bit.ly/subscribeMT
This video is based on my quest for the graves of Indian Soldiers in Gallipoli, Turkey. I started my day from the Gelibolu (Gallipoli) town. Took a local bus from Gelibolu to Kilitbahir. Visited war cemeteries, monuments and a War Museum (Çanakkale Destanı Tanıtım Merkezi) also called Epic Promotion Centre, Kabatepe Tanıtma Merkezi Ve Müzesi. I have shared the museum and 3D show fees in the video. Afterwards, I visited Directorate of Gallipoli Historical Site (Çanakkale Savaşları Gelibolu) to collect more information about Indian soldiers who fought for the British during the World War 1 against the Ottoman empire in Gallipoli. In the end, I visited the Beach Cemetery, Gallipoli.

title: Why Indians never came back from MAURITIUS !!
description:
http://bit.ly/subscribeMT
This video is based on the 3rd day of my Mauritius Trip. I visited Aapravasi Ghat, the place where the Indians landed in Mauritius during the early 1800s. In this video, you will come to know about the condition of those Indians who came to Mauritius as labourers or indentured labourers. After Apravasi ghat or Immigration depot we visited the Central Market in Port Louis. I had a few conversations with the 'Indian' community. Watch this to know the price of mobile sim in Mauritius, Price of the Local street food in Mauritius, etc. In this video you will also see Caudan waterfront, Blue Penny Museum, Adelaide fort, Escale Creole restaurant and Hotel Sofitel Mauritius L'Impérial Resort & Spa, Coastal Road, Flic en Flac, Mauritius.

title: My stay in Langkawi, Malaysia (Hostel near Cenang beach)
description:
Click here to book and read unbiased review: https://goo.gl/8r1A55
I started with hitchhiking in Langkawi. Met a few wonderful people of Langkawi. They dropped me at a hostel which I initially booked, but probably due to overbooking the hostel arranged a better stay in a nearby hostel. So I finally got to stay in 'Villa Thai' which is a hostel/hotel near Cenang beach. They have rooms as well as a dormitory for tourists. After that, I visited Cenang beach. In the video, you can see many hotels, guesthouses, hostel near Cenang beach. I Spent a good time walking on the beach and Cenang street.

title: Istanbul Ataturk Airport - ATM | Tourist Sim | Taxi & Metro | Istanbul Airport to Sultan Ahmet
description:
http://bit.ly/subscribeMT & http://www.touristhelpline.com/istanbul-airport-guide-taxi-metro-sim-atm-istanbulkart-my-experience/
This video is based on my experience at the Istanbul Ataturk Airport. Information shared in this video is based on - the best and cheapest way to go from Istanbul airport to city centre. I travelled via Istanbul Metro from Istanbul airport to Sultan Ahmet, a tourist hub in Istanbul. I have also shared inputs on sim card in Turkey. For eg, I have mentioned the cost of Turkcell and Vodafone sim available at the airport. Although there are many other sim card companies in Turkey which you will come to know in upcoming videos. What is the best way to get Turkish Lira at the airport! I used the HSBC atm at Istanbul airport to withdraw money. Though I got a poor exchange rate. After withdrawing the money I purchased a smartcard which is valid in all trams, metro, buses and even toilets in Istanbul, the name of this smartcard is IstanbulKart. Watch this video to know IstanbulKart fares and how to get IstanbulKart at the airport?

title: I hitchhiked with a Girl (1st time), but...
description:
I tried to hitchhike with a girl for the first time on my Kyrgyzstan trip. Watch this video to see how was my experience! We tried did this while going from Bishkek to Song Kul Lake which is quite a popular lake in Kyrgyzstan. On the way, we stopped at Kant and Tokmok city to change vehicles. 

0:00 start
0:13 what is volunteering for travellers, backpackers
1:00 How I am going to Hitchhike with a girl!
2:33 Bishkek to Kant in a bus / Marshrutka Fare
3:41 Our first attempt of Hitchhiking together was unsuccessful 
6:24 Challenges when travelling with someone
7:46 Cost of Vegetarian food in a restaurant in Tokmok city. Learn more about Shawarma, Piroshki and Lepyoshka
8:40 Best place to buy a bus ticket in Kyrgyzstan. Travel Tips
10:17 Taxi Car fare from Tokmok to Kochkor
11:08 Why I got worried for her!
12:53 Kochkor to Songkul Lake trip starts

This video is a part of my Kyrgyzstan travel series - http://bit.ly/MTkyrgyzstan2019. I spent 3 months in Kyrgyzstan in late 2019. Besides Bishkek, Karakol, Issyk Kul (lake) which are the most popular destinations in Kyrgyzstan, I visited some offbeat places like Jyrgalan valley, Song Kul (lake). Did horse riding trips, stayed in Yurt camps, hitchhiked and stayed with locals. I volunteered in village farms, hostels and NGOs to get the holistic experience of my trip and central Asian culture. All this you will find In this series. #Kyrgyzstan #hitchhiking #SoloTravel

title: Indian hitchhiker in Siberia : Altai Mountains, Russia
description:
SUBSCRIBE - https://goo.gl/dEtSMJ (‘MountainTrekker’)
Previous video - https://youtu.be/NaGqRZLJrd0

This is the Second video of Day-10 of my Russian trip in which you will see me exploring the Altai Mountains, the unexplored part of beautiful Russia. I managed to reach Onguday with the help of a lovely elderly couple. After that, I got a lift in another car from Onguday to Geyzernoye Ozero, a place near Aktach. I stayed with Dima and Tanya in a log hut in Geyzernoye Ozero. We all paid 500 Rubles each for a night. Interestingly that was the coldest night of my trip. The temperature dipped to almost -10-degree Celsius. More details - http://www.touristhelpline.com/altai-mountains-unexplored-russia-onguday/

title: THAILAND: Free Visa on Arrival till APRIL 2020 | Sample Visa form | Documents | Tourist Sim
description:
http://bit.ly/subscribeMT
This video is based on the process of getting Thailand's visa on arrival at Bangkok's Suvarnabhumi international airport. After landing at the BKK airport I went to search for the visa on arrival form, stood in a queue, submitted the documents for Thai visa on arrival and then got the visa stamped on my passport. While giving you a tour of Bangkok's Suvarnabhumi airport, I have shot and shared the entire process of getting Thailand's visa, Thai immigration, getting foreign exchange at Bangkok airport. I have also shared the sample of Thai visa on arrival form. After that, I went to purchase the local mobile sim at one of the shops at the airport itself. So if you are looking for the best sim card for tourists in Thailand then this is a must watch video. #Thailand #ThaiVisa #ThailandVisaonArrival

title: NEW YORK during Covid | USA Immigration Interview | My entire Transit process at JFK Airport
description:
My Air Serbia flight from Belgrade to New York landed at JFK Airport, one of the busiest airports in the world. However, the airport was different during covid. After completing the Immigration and Customs check I took the Free Inter-terminal train to reach Terminal 8 to catch my next flight to Miami. Watch this video to know about how was my overall experience of transiting through the USA and using John F Kennedy Airport for transit. and several frequently asked questions like, Do you need a visa for a connecting flight in the USA?  How to catch a connecting flight at JFK Airport in New York? 

0:00 - flight landed at New York
1:28 - Mobile Passport Control USA
2:00 - Immigration questions in USA
3:27 - New York vs Newark Airport
4:11 - Transit Baggage rules, New York USA 
5:49 - Internet speed at New York JFK Airport 
6:00  - Luggage cart at JFK Airport is not Free
6:44 - US Transit visa for Indians?
7:22 - JFK Airport Map
7:44 - Free Air Trains between terminals at New York Airport JFK

10:28 - Baggage Drop American Airlines JFK New York
12:50 - Security check at JFK New york

This video was shot in November 2020 #USAtransit #CovidTravel #MountainTrekkerUSA

title: Visiting the Canadian side of Niagara Falls in Winter
description:
http://bit.ly/subscribeMT
On the second day of my Canada trip, I took a boat trip to Niagara Falls on Hornblower cruise. I have shared the ticket price & timings of the Hornblower cruise. If you are looking for a hotel near Niagara falls offering the best views of the falls! Let me tell you that I stayed in the Sheraton on the Falls hotel and my room, as well as the restaurant, offered a great view of all the 3 falls of Niagara Falls. There are many other places to visit near Niagara Falls like Skylon Tower which has an observatory deck to have a panoramic view of Niagara Falls & the areas in USA & Canada around it. This video also includes a few glimpses of QEW expressway which is the road from Toronto to Niagara Falls or US border. 
#NiagaraFalls #Canada #Niagara

title: Dubai Visa-free Transit during COVID [SERBIA EP 3] - eng subtitles
description:
This video is all about Dubai airport’s connecting flight procedure. I used visa-free transit at Dubai airport (DXB) during COVID in September 2020. Many people may be willing to travel out of India, but due to travel restrictions still, almost all international flights to & from India are closed. However, the UAE is open. Many flights from India to Dubai are now available - Spicejet, Go, Indigo, AI Exp, Emirates. Free Transit is at Dubai airport is also available like before (Don’t need US visa). Even Terminal transfer is possible without the hassle. However, there are a few rules and things to be considered. #DubaiAirport #DXBfreeTransit #IndianTraveller

0:00 - Why Dubai?
0:52 - Visa-Free Transit process in Dubai currently
1:48 - No visa needed for transit passengers
3:43 - COVID test at Dubai Airport
4:04 - How to get boarding pass for next flight
4:40 - checked-in Baggage Dubai Transit
5:55 - Merhaba service Dubai airport

8:09 - Documents for free transit at DXB
9:25 - How to book fully refundable Return ticket

11:08 - How to find best/cheapest flight connections?

16:12 - Emirates Delhi Dubai flight baggage during COVID

Onward flight ticket, Return flight ticket, Hotel booking, Destination country’s Visa (if applicable), COVID negative report

title: An Indian in Egypt | Nile River | Luxor temples | Egypt Trains | Bollywood fans
description:
http://bit.ly/subscribeMT
In this video, you will watch me crossing the Nile river in the cheapest possible way. I just paid 1 L.E (3.5 Indian Rupees) to cross the Nile river in a public boat. Again I was hassled by the touts, taxi drivers, travel agents, etc. at the West Bank. I have also shared my experience of tourist scam in Cambodia - Thailand trip. I visited the Hatshepsut temple. I have shared the information about the entry ticket in Hatshepsut temple. I had Koshari, Roz Belaban and Fool in the lunch. So you will see it is not difficult to get the vegetarian food in Egypt. Also, you will see a few crazy Bollywood fans of Egypt. I came back to Luxor train station to catch the train to Cairo. You will also get a glimpse of the coming video in which I am going to show you my train journey from Luxor to Cairo, my experience in Cairo Metro and the famous place in Cairo, Tahrir square.

title: A day in Boston | My USA trip 2018
description:
http://bit.ly/subscribeMT

This video is about my first trip to Boston, USA. You will see Boston city and the suburban areas of the city. The best way to explore Boston is by using public transport. I have shared a few inputs on the public transportation in Boston. MBTA operates Boston's subway, buses, commuter rails and ferries. I have also shared information on how to travel in Boston by using a tourist pass. This includes the cost of Charlie ticket (public transport ticket), how to use Charlie card or Chalie ticket in Boston, benefits of using a Charlie ticket for a tourist and many more information.

title: Cairo/ Giza: Local transport | Hotels | offline Maps | Tourist Hassles in Egypt (2018)
description:
http://bit.ly/subscribeMT
After arriving from Alexandria, I took a bus to Giza Pyramids from a bus terminal inside the city of Giza. Thanks to the helpful people who guided me to the bus terminal. In the initial part of the video, you will see the mad traffic of Giza; you'll get a glimpse local transportation in Egypt. The bus I took to my hotel in Giza is called minibus. I have shared information about the Minibus fare in Cairo and Giza. The person sitting beside me also helped me to understand the mobile service providers in Egypt. So there is a mention of the best mobile network in Egypt. 

The video will also show you the hotel rating scam which I went through. The people, in general, are helpful, but there were few incidents which lead to tourist's harassments. Such events make a tourist feel unsafe in Egypt. In the latter part of the video, you'll find hotels near Giza Pyramids. I stayed in one of them. I got a good view of the pyramids from its rooftop.

title: (Sikh Temple) GURUDWARA IN USA | My Hitchhiking trip 2018
description:
http://bit.ly/subscribeMT

This video is about my visit to a Gurudwara in USA. This was my first ever visit to an American Gurudwara. If you are still struggling with what actually a  Gurudwara is, then let me tell you... They are the religious place or the place of worship for the followers of Sikh religion. Watch this video to know how to enter a Gurudwara and how I relished the free meals which are a very noble concept of Gurudwaras. You can also help the Gurudwara by doing different things which I and Rahul did. After this, you will see me struggling to get a ride. I tried to resume my hitchhiking trip in USA. Watch to know whether it is safe to hitchhike at night in USA?

title: Serbian GIRLS LIFT KYU NAHI DETI !! (Cacak to Aranjelovac) | SERBIA #31
description:
Why girls are hesitant to accept a hitchhiker! Watch this video and you'll come to know how was my experience of a hitchhiking in Serbia during covid. After getting an easy ride from Uzice to Cacak, I started again to ask for lifts. It was not a good day to hitchhike. Neither was hitchhiking easy! Still thanks to the people who gave me rides. The route I followed - Uzice, Cacak, Gorni Milanovac, Rudnik, Topola, Aranjelovac. This video was shot in October 2020. Watch the entire Serbian series at -

title: Meeting a modest Pakistani | FLYING A 'SECRET' AIRLINE | Avia Traffic: Bishkek to Delhi, Non stop
description:
Searching for a direct flight to Kyrgyzstan, then watch this video. This airline is not shown by online ticket booking portals. I am talking about Avia Traffic, which I took while flying back from Kyrgyzstan to India. Here is my overall experience, booking details, contact numbers and a special mention about a trick to get discounted fare on Avia Traffic. Do check the timestamps for more details.  

Avia Traffic Delhi contact number - (+91)9911188888/ (+91) 01141387319
Avia Traffic Email (Skyline Team) - booking@asianskylineteam.com

0:00 - Cheapest flight Delhi-Bishkek
0:40 - Departure, Manas International Airport, Bishkek

1:39 - Direct Flight duration Kyrgyzstan to India 
2:31 - Avia Traffic Contact Delhi/Bishkek
2:54 - Bishkek Airport Tour
3:37 - Avia Traffic Baggage fee (My Trick)

10:43 - Boarding Avia Traffic plane, Seats, Food
12:07 - Landing at Delhi Airport
15:47 - Review of my Kyrgyzstan Trip

This video is a part of my Kyrgyzstan travel series - http://bit.ly/MTkyrgyzstan2019. I spent 3 months in Kyrgyzstan in late 2019. Besides Bishkek, Karakol, Issyk Kul (lake) which are the most popular destinations in Kyrgyzstan, I visited some offbeat places like Jyrgalan valley, Song Kul (lake). Did horse riding trips, stayed in Yurt camps, hitchhiked and stayed with locals. I volunteered in village farms, hostels and NGOs to get the holistic experience of my trip and central Asian culture. All this you will find In this series. #Kyrgyzstan #IndianTraveller #AviaTraffic

title: Washington DC day trip | Tourist attractions | Best way to visit DC
description:
http://bit.ly/subscribeMT
 
This video is about my day trip to Washington DC, the capital of the United States of America. You can see me travelling from Virginia to Washington DC by public transport. I took a local PRTC bus to Springfield Franconia metro station. Metro is the best way to reach Washington DC if you are staying in suburban areas. I took a metro from Springfield Franconia to Smithsonian station. Smithsonian metro station the nearest metro station for Washington Monument, National Mall, Holocaust museum, White House and other important tourist attractions. I have shared information about Washington metro fare and Washington metro one day pass, which is a prefered way to travel in DC for tourists. At the end of the day, I visited the Capitol building. Watch this video to see the beautiful family of my host in Virginia.

title: Serbian GIRLS LIFT KYU NAHI DETI !! (Cacak to Aranjelovac) | SERBIA #31
description:
Why girls are hesitant to accept a hitchhiker! Watch this video and you'll come to know how was my experience of a hitchhiking in Serbia during covid. After getting an easy ride from Uzice to Cacak, I started again to ask for lifts. It was not a good day to hitchhike. Neither was hitchhiking easy! Still thanks to the people who gave me rides. The route I followed - Uzice, Cacak, Gorni Milanovac, Rudnik, Topola, Aranjelovac. This video was shot in October 2020. Watch the entire Serbian series at -

title: The longest ride in a Truck | Hitchhiking in USA
description:
http://bit.ly/subscribeMT

This is the 20th video of my 'American trip - 2018' where I tried to check how easy is hitchhiking in USA!  In this video you will see me starting the trip from Alabama and reaching Texas in just one ride. This was the longest ever ride I had in the US. Thanks to Jovani, a Cuban-American trucker for the lift. It took almost a day to reach the truck stop in Terrell, the final point in the Texas. Watch this video to know about the camping grounds for RVs in America, to see the landscapes of Alabama, Mississippi & Texas, to see how are the truck stops in these areas and to see how is Interstate 20, i.e. i-20!

title: Meeting a modest Pakistani | FLYING A 'SECRET' AIRLINE | Avia Traffic: Bishkek to Delhi, Non stop
description:
Searching for a direct flight to Kyrgyzstan, then watch this video. This airline is not shown by online ticket booking portals. I am talking about Avia Traffic, which I took while flying back from Kyrgyzstan to India. Here is my overall experience, booking details, contact numbers and a special mention about a trick to get discounted fare on Avia Traffic. Do check the timestamps for more details.  

Avia Traffic Delhi contact number - (+91)9911188888/ (+91) 01141387319
Avia Traffic Email (Skyline Team) - booking@asianskylineteam.com

0:00 - Cheapest flight Delhi-Bishkek
0:40 - Departure, Manas International Airport, Bishkek
1:15 - Website for cheap flights (https://youtu.be/NjG5ZwuY0Rc)
1:39 - Direct Flight duration Kyrgyzstan to India 
2:31 - Avia Traffic Contact Delhi/Bishkek
2:54 - Bishkek Airport Tour
3:37 - Avia Traffic Baggage fee (My Trick)
4:09 - Avia Traffic Bishkek Check-in process
5:09 - Avia Traffic Cabin Baggage size weight
5:23 - Avia Traffic inflight Meals Vegetarian 
5:50 - Avia Traffic discount fare (Delhi-Bishkek)
7:08 - Met a Pakistani Subscriber at Bishkek Airport
9:01 - TouristHelpline Facebook Group on Kartarpur Corridor
9:45 - Reminiscing Thailand 
10:43 - Boarding Avia Traffic plane, Seats, Food
12:07 - Landing at Delhi Airport
15:47 - Review of my Kyrgyzstan Trip

This video is a part of my Kyrgyzstan travel series - http://bit.ly/MTkyrgyzstan2019. I spent 3 months in Kyrgyzstan in late 2019. Besides Bishkek, Karakol, Issyk Kul (lake) which are the most popular destinations in Kyrgyzstan, I visited some offbeat places like Jyrgalan valley, Song Kul (lake). Did horse riding trips, stayed in Yurt camps, hitchhiked and stayed with locals. I volunteered in village farms, hostels and NGOs to get the holistic experience of my trip and central Asian culture. All this you will find In this series. #Kyrgyzstan #IndianTraveller #AviaTraffic

title: Washington DC day trip | Tourist attractions | Best way to visit DC
description:
http://bit.ly/subscribeMT
 
This video is about my day trip to Washington DC, the capital of the United States of America. You can see me travelling from Virginia to Washington DC by public transport. I took a local PRTC bus to Springfield Franconia metro station. Metro is the best way to reach Washington DC if you are staying in suburban areas. I took a metro from Springfield Franconia to Smithsonian station. Smithsonian metro station the nearest metro station for Washington Monument, National Mall, Holocaust museum, White House and other important tourist attractions. I have shared information about Washington metro fare and Washington metro one day pass, which is a prefered way to travel in DC for tourists. At the end of the day, I visited the Capitol building. Watch this video to see the beautiful family of my host in Virginia.

title: This American Truck driver Loves HINDI  !!
description:
http://bit.ly/subscribeMT
This video is based on the 22nd day of my US trip. The day began in Texas and finished at another truck stop in Tonkawa, Oklahoma. I met Mark, an American Trucker in Texas. We had discussions on a number of topics, including a rule which binds the truck driver in the US not to drive more than 11 hours a day. He also shared his experience of before and after this rule. I wish this rule is also implemented in India where everyday we lose almost 400 people in road accidents. He also speaks about his love towards the Hindi language and the Indian people. You will also see another trucker, Sonu, a Punjabi helping me to reach the last point of the day, Tonkawa.

title: AMERICAN TRAINS | my first journey - Amtrak Sunset Limited - REVIEW
description:
This video is based on my first journey with Amtrak from Houston to Tucson. This train was Sunset Limited which travel from New Orleans, Louisiana to Los Angeles, California. I paid 108$ for this 24+ hour-long journey. The train reached 4 hours late at my destination.

title: Langkawi to Kuala lumpur : Last day of my Malaysia trip
description:
This is the last video of my Malaysian travel series. Watch this video to see how I started my trip from Langkawi to Kuala Lumpur. I took a ferry from Langkawi jetty to Kuala Perlis. Ferry fare from Langkawi to Kuala Perlis is 18 Ringgit, and journey duration was around 1 hour. From Kuala Perlis to Kuala Lumpur I hitchhiked. Met a lot of wonderful people. In the whole trip of Malaysia, I met a lot of Malaysian fans of Bollywood star Shahrukh Khan. In this video, you will see another die-hard fan of SRK (Shahrukh Khan)

title: This way I said 'BISMILLAH' IN SANSKRIT! (in Kavrun Mountain, Turkey)
description:
http://bit.ly/subscribeMT
Thanks to hitchhiking which helped me to meet many interesting people and explore a few non-touristy places in Turkey. Karun Yaylasi is a small village in Rize province which I found is one of the offbeat places in Turkey. Watch this video to see the beauty of Kavrun. I slept in Kavrun Cami, the only mosque in the last village of that road. Though there are a few guest houses called pansiyon in Kavrun.

title: AIR SERBIA | BELGRADE to NEW YORK | SERBIA ep #41
description:
why Indians are not being allowed to reach the USA via most of the countries in Europe? I have mentioned the reason for flying with Air Serbia. Do watch it to know the in-flight entertainment service, meals, drinks and other facilities provided by Air Serbia for economy class passengers. Also, let's revive our memories of the beautiful trip of Serbia. The video was shot in November 2020. I am thankful to the people of Serbia for making this trip beautiful. We'll see you soon. Hvala Puno, vidimo se 😊👍🏻

This video is a part of travel web series based on my trip to Serbia. I travelled from Delhi to Belgrade via Dubai availing visa-free entry for Indians in Serbia for 30 days. Watch all the videos in sequence here http://bit.ly/MTserbia2020. #SerbiatoUSA #AirSerbiaReview #BelgradeAirport

title: ISTANBUL: GRAND BAZAR | EGYPTIAN SPICE BAZAR
description:
http://bit.ly/subscribeMT
This video is based on my visit to Grand Bazar, Istanbul. Watch this to know interesting facts about the Grand Bazaar, which once upon a time had to be the world's largest mall. Thereafter I visited Spice bazar or called Egyptian bazar. Both the markets are quite big and are popular tourist attractions in Istanbul. So I was recommended these places as the must-visit place for a tourist in Istanbul, besides Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. I met a lot of interesting people on the way. Thereafter I went to Eminonu to catch the ferry to Uskudar. I have shared the process of getting on to the ferry and the free fare to Uskudar. The beginning of the video you will see me visiting a Tourist Information centre in Sultan Ahmet, which I always recommend. The gentleman in the centre helped me to plan the itinerary for Turkey trip.
#Istanbul #GrandBazar #TouristPlacesIstanbul

title: AIZAWL : Hotels, Local transport, Mobile network, Bike Taxi...(from a Delhiite's eyes)
description:
bit.ly/subscribeMT
This video is about my first day's experience of visiting Aizawl. I am sharing the information based on several topics. In the beginning, I have shared information regarding the public transport between Lengpui Airport to Aizawl. There are no public buses between the Lengpui airport and Aizawl city. The fare from Lengpui airport to Aizawl in a Sumo starts from 2000 Rs. Check the link for cheaper prepaid taxi fares. touristhelpline.com/visiting-aizawl-mizoram

Thereafter, in the video, I have shared information on the places to stay in Aizawl. There are a lot of private hotels in Aizawl, but I stayed in a Government guest house in Chaltlang, Aizawl. Rooms are available from Rs 600, and on-phone booking is possible. Check the link to get the phone number of Chaltlang tourist lodge. Next topic is related to Best time to visit Mizoram and vegetarian food in Aizawl. After that, I went to experience the public transport in Aizawl. I have shared in the video about Aizawl's minibus fare and taxi fares. Beware of Aizawl's traffic jams. You can also take a bike taxi in Aizawl to dodge the traffic jams. I have shared the bike taxi fare in the link. 

I have also shared my experience with the mobile networks in Aizawl. How Jio, Airtel, BSNL and Vodafone worked for me in Mizoram.

CHECK - www.touristhelpline.com/visiting-aizawl-mizoram

description:

title: INDIAN ROBBED in BELGRADE || Visiting Serbia? Watch this first | SERBIA #33
description:
This video is about a daylight robbery with an Indian tourist from Punjab in the Serbian capital Belgrade. He was robbed in the main tourist area near Moscow hotel. However, he managed to get back some of his things robbed. Watch this video to know more about his experience and how he got his things back. Also, watch it to meet an inspirational Indian who is visually challenged but travelling solo around the world. This video was shot in November 2020. 

This video is a part of travel web series based on my trip to Serbia. I travelled from Delhi to Belgrade via Dubai availing the visa-free entry for Indians in Serbia for 30 days. Watch all the videos in sequence here http://bit.ly/MTserbia2020. #TravelSafety #SerbiaTravel #IndianinSerbia

title: Egypt to India | Saudia | An Indian flying over Pakistan - How was it!
description:
http://bit.ly/subscribeMT
This video is about my journey from Cairo to Delhi. 
This features a small ride in Cairo Metro, where I have shared a few vital information about the Cairo metro fare, Cairo metro map, Cairo metro website, etc. Thereafter I reached Tahrir Square, an iconic place in Cairo. I took a microbus from Cairo to Alexandria. This is possibly the cheapest way to travel from Cairo to Alexandria. Check this video to know the bus fare between Alexandria and Cairo. I have also shared about the cheapest way to travel between Alexandria airport and the downtown Alexandria. It just cost me 27 EGP to reach the Borg El Arab airport from Alexandria city. This will show you the public transportation between the airport and Alexandria city. Then you'll come to know about the so-called facilities available at the Alexandria airport. I landed at the Jeddah airport. Flying between Alexandria and Jeddah with Saudia was not a good experience. Watch this video to know why! 

While at Jeddah, I came to know about a trick to enjoy the long layovers at Jeddah airport. Thanks to Saudia for the good vegeterian meal served during the Jeddah to Delhi flight. Welcome back to India.

description:
Met her on a bus. One of the most friendly Serbian I met on my trip. This video also includes a bus trip without a ticket. I am sure this would be an interesting story for you. After this, I am going to show you my hostel, friendly hostel mates and then finally Capoeira! A martial art from Brazil, though I saw it for the first time in Belgrade, Serbia. 

This video is a part of travel web series based on my trip to Serbia. I travelled from Delhi to Belgrade via Dubai availing the visa-free entry for Indians in Serbia for 30 days. Watch all the videos in sequence here http://bit.ly/MTserbia2020. #IndianinSerbia #SerbiaTravel #MountainTrekker

title: Most beautiful village in Turkey with friendliest villagers
description:
http://bit.ly/subscribeMT
This was supposed to be my last day in Turkey, but it seems I was destined to visit some of the most amazing places in Turkey that day. While hitchhiking to the Turkey Georgia border from Savsat to Ardahan, I met another wonderful person who invited me to visit his village. Watch this video to know the interesting story behind my journey. The village I stayed in is called Kocabey köyü in the şavşat district of Artvin province. I visited Karagol lake situated in the Karagol Sahara National park. After that, another lake called Belik Golu, Artvin. The most beautiful part was the hospitality of my host and the people of Kocabey village. Watch this video to see some of the most beautiful landscapes of Turkey.

title: Turkey-Georgia Aktaş border: Crossing on foot | HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE
description:
http://bit.ly/subscribeMT
I crossed the Turkey-Georgia border from Aktas border gate. I tried to record most of the things on camera and have shared crucial information on topics like - Aktas border opening & closing time, Georgia immigration, How to get Georgia visa for Indians considering the high deportation rate of Indians, Georgian currency Lari exchange, etc. After travelling quite a few countries including the USA & Canada, till now this was the most difficult immigration process for me. Watch this video and do not repeat the mistakes I did while immigration and improve your chances of getting an entry in Georgia as a tourist. 
#GeogiaVisa #TurkeyGeorgiaBorder #OverlandCrossing

title: [Part 2] Finding Indian Soldier's Graves after 103 years | Gallipoli, Turkey
description:
http://bit.ly/subscribeMT

I was informed that in a particular event the Indian soldiers were attacked by the Allied forces who actually brought them in Turkey. Watch this video to know details on the role of Indian soldiers in Gallipoli, World War-1. I got emotional after seeing the names of Indian soldiers for the first time. title: Cheapest way to travel in Toronto | I found it
description:
http://bit.ly/subscribeMT

While travelling in Toronto using public Transport I came across the most interesting thing which I have shared in detail in this video. 6 people can travel on a single pass in any transportation mode of the TTC system. My day started with a free walk tour from Union Station, Toronto. I came to know about PATH, an underground system which was the most interesting part of the walking tour. Though something happened at the end of the tour which was not a pleasant experience. Then I visited the Royal Ontario Museum by using Toronto's public transport. After that, I took a Street Car to China Town. Had dim sum at one of the Chinese restaurants in Chinatown Toronto. The day ended with the Art gallery of Ontario which was very close to my hotel Chelsea.

title: A EUROPEAN BORDER, WITHOUT POLICE (Serbia - Romania crossing) | SERBIA #37
description:
There was no border police at this crossing between 2 European countries, Serbia & Romania. No one came to ask what was I doing at the border Checkpost. Just across the Border is the European Union. In fact when I went moved just a few meters away from this Checkpost, I couldn’t see any fence between these countries (Serbia-Romania) to stop illegal crossing. This video also has explained how people in Europe keep their homes warm during the winter. Watch this video to know about their unique heating system, Kelebija border crossing between Serbia & Hungary, my apartment in Subotica, Lake Palic, visa rules for Indians to enter Romania. This video was shot in November 2020.

This video is a part of travel web series based on my trip to Serbia. I travelled from Delhi to Belgrade via Dubai availing the visa-free entry for Indians in Serbia for 30 days. Watch all the videos in sequence here http://bit.ly/MTserbia2020. #RomaniaBorder #IndianinSerbia #Europe

title: CANADA | Train to Halifax | One of the best scenic train trips
description:
http://bit.ly/subscribeMT
This video is based on my train journey from Quebec City to Halifax. After doing this 20 hours journey, I can say it is one of the most beautiful train rides in the world. I have shared information on the facilities available on a Via Rail train for passengers. For eg, restaurants, pantry, free wifi, etc. The best thing about this train journey was the dome coach of the train where anyone can come and sit for free. This journey was actually a joy ride for me.

title: Air India: Kolkata-Bangkok flight Review | Worst or Best! Indians must watch
description:
http://bit.ly/subscribeMT
This is based on my Air India flight from Kolkata to Bangkok. I have shared the reasons for flying with Air India. Though there are many budget airlines for Thailand from India, cons like limited leg space, no free checked-in luggage, no complimentary in-flight food, etc are some points which will make you rethink before you buy a budget flight ticket to Thailand. I have highlighted a few things about Air India which may help especially an Indian tourist. Watch Air India's flight review and decide it is still the worst or best airline in India connecting Thailand. #AirIndia #BangkokFlight #KolkatatoBangkok

title: Cheapest place to stay in Seoul | AirConditioned Camps
description:

title: Bye Rahul | An Indian's life in America
description:
http://bit.ly/subscribeMT


It time to say Good Bye to a dear friend, Rahul whom I met just a week back. This was our first ever meeting. He is another Indian in USA. So, In this video, I have tried to share some information on the life of an Indian in USA. Rahul has shared how and when did he land in the USA and how has been his life since then!  Also, I have shown a glimpse of the place where he lives in Atlanta. The facilities available for the residents of an average American residential colony.  We also talk about the so-called 'development' & Jungles, our approach towards the differently abled people, etc.

title: An Indian's day trip to Belokurikha Resort: ALTAI MOUNTAINS, RUSSIA
description:
SUBSCRIBE - https://goo.gl/dEtSMJ (‘MountainTrekker’)

This video is about my visit to Belokurikha, a resort in Altai Krai province in Russia. The route from Biysk to Belokurikha is very picturesque. This trip gave me the first glimpse of the Altai Mountains which reminded me of The Himalayas. Thanks to my host family for taking me to such a beautiful place. Watch this video to see how beautiful is Belokurikha and what activities did I do on the day-long trip.

title: Turkey : Aamir Khan | Indian Army soldiers from World War 1
description:
This video is the part of my KTG (Kazakhstan, Turkey and Georgia trip) series http://bit.ly/MTktg2018. Based on the experiences I had while visiting Gallipoli. Thanks to my Couchsurfing host in Gallipoli because of whom I could see the town. Gallipoli has got a great significance in the history of India. During World War 1 thousands of Indian soldiers fought in Gallipoli for their British rulers. On the opposite side were the soldiers of the erstwhile Ottoman Empire. My host was a teacher and took me to his school. I met a lot of teachers and we interacted on a lot of topics. I came to know that Aamir Khan’s ‘Taare Zameen Par’ or ‘Every Child is Special’, as it is known in Turkey is a very popular movie. The Government of Turkey advice teachers in Turkey to watch Taare Zameen Par. During the whole trip, I found Aamir Khan is very popular in Turkey. Thanks to Bollywood for making us popular in Turkey.
#Turkey #AamirKhan #IndianArmy

title: Which Bollywood movie was shot in Serbia? (with ENG SUB) [SERBIA EP 13]
description:
This Bollywood film was not shot in Kashmir but in Serbia. I met the production manager of this film on my Serbian trip. If you are still struggling with the name, this was the famous Hindi movie 'Uri'. Watch this video to see a small town in Serbia - Pozarevac and the cool and relaxed lifestyle of the people there. There are many things in this video about Serbian culture which should have been a part of India and the Indian culture. Follow these Timestamps for more details in this video

title: my WORST CAR RENTAL experience ever (watch this before renting anywhere in the world) | SERBIA #35
description:
A must watch if you are renting a car, bike, speedboat or anything in a foreign country. I had a terrible experience in Serbia when I rented a car at Belgrade Airport. Based on what happened, I can say the worst car agency at Belgrade airport is ‘AR Rent a Car’. Watch this video and you’ll come to know about the things you must know before renting a car anywhere in the world. How rental agencies try to trap their customers. So go through my experience to avoid such tourist scams while travelling.  

This video is a part of travel web series based on my trip to Serbia. I travelled from Delhi to Belgrade via Dubai availing the visa-free entry for Indians in Serbia for 30 days. Watch all the videos in sequence here http://bit.ly/MTserbia2020. #TouristScam #Serbia #IndianinSerbia

title: Indians in Kyrgyzstan | Itni badi family!!
description:
More than 16,000 Indian students study medicine in Kyrgyzstan. I met a lot of them in Bishkek during my visit. This video is based on some planned and unplanned ‘encounters’ with them. 
  
0:00 - Tribute to COVID Warrior 
1:26 - Recap, Last Video (https://youtu.be/uHfrKMVDCMc)
3:41 - Bishkek Park Mall, Fan moments
5:53 - Business opportunities for Indians in Kyrgyzstan
7:51 - Which are CIS countries?
8:45 - Meeting Pakistanis in Kyrgyzstan
12:14 - Indian Medical students in Kyrgyzstan in 2019
14:48 - My ‘first’ subscriber
17:42 - Right or Left-hand drive in Kyrgyzstan!
18:45 - Cost of cars in Kyrgyzstan
20:20 - Before you move abroad
22:30 - Reason to watch MountainTrekker
26:20 - Pay 3000 Fine, Traffic Rules Kyrgyzstan
30:12 - Indian-Pakistani started ‘fighting’

This video is a part of my Kyrgyzstan travel series - http://bit.ly/MTkyrgyzstan2019. I spent 3 months in Kyrgyzstan in late 2019. Besides Bishkek, Karakol, Issyk Kul (lake) which are the most popular destinations in Kyrgyzstan, I visited some offbeat places like Jyrgalan valley, Song Kul (lake). Did horse riding trips, stayed in Yurt camps, hitchhiked and stayed with locals. I volunteered in village farms, hostels and NGOs to get the holistic experience of my trip and central Asian culture. All this you will find In this series. #Kyrgyzstan #IndianTraveller #Meetup

title: When India saw 'Iran & USA' and 'Russia & Ukraine' hugging each other!
description:
http://bit.ly/subscribeMT
This video is based on my journey from Denizli to Pamukkale. My stay in Pamukkale. A visit to Karahayit, a small village near Pamukkale. Hot water springs in Karahayit and the best part - meeting lots of Couchsurfers in Pamukkale. After watching this video you'll come to know about various things like - Denizli Bus Terminal, How to reach Pamukkale by train from Istanbul. Trains between Denizli & Izmir, Ankara, Eskisehir, etc.  Train fare from Istanbul to Denizli. Bus fare from Denizli to Pamukkale.  Denizli Railway station which is also known as Denizli Gari. title: Visiting World’s Cleanest, no-Crowd Beach | HOW I GOT THERE? (Playa Bahia de las Aguilas) [DR #11]
description:
[Turn On Eng Subtitles] This was the best beach I had ever seen. Reaching one of the most offbeat places in the Dominican Republic was not easy though. I was awarded the prestigious 'National Tourism Award' by the Government of India for my contributions in the field of promotion of Tourism. Thanks to my viewers, because of whom now I get invitations from across the globe to visit their places and show them to the world.
